com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body
Class ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

java.lang.Object
  com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyUtility
      com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBody
          com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

public class ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization
extends ID3v23FrameBody

An position synchronization frame body is associated with an ID3v2.3 POSS frame which is used to deliver information to the listener on how far into the audio stream he picked up. In effect, it states the time offset of the first frame in the stream. The position synchronization frame body contains the following fields:

Attached Picture Frame Body Fields
 FieldDescription
1. time stamp formatunits of the position field.
5. position the position in the audio the listener starts to receive, i.e. the beginning of the next frame.

There may only be one position synchronization frame in the tag.

See Also:
ID3v23Frame, ID3 tag version 2.3.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

Constructor Detail

ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

public ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization()
The default constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
  • time stamp format in milliseconds
  • position 0

ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

public ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization(TimeStampFormat timeStampFormat,
                                              int position)
This constructor is called when creating a new frame.

Parameters:
timeStampFormat - units of the time stamp. see ID3v23FrameBody.setTimeStampFormat(TimeStampFormat)
position - position within song

ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization

public ID3v23FrameBodyPositionSynchronization(java.io.FileInputStream file,
                                              int frameBodySize)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.

Parameters:
file - input stream pointing to a position synchronization frame body in the .mp3 file.
frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setBuffer

public void setBuffer()
If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.

Overrides:
setBuffer in class ID3v23FrameBody

gets a string representation of the position synchronization frame body showing all of the frame's fields and their values.

Overrides:

Returns:
a string representation of the frame body.
